subject: Re: [junit] JUnit works great in IDE, how do I run it from a shell?
msgSnippet: Pat, On Windows, I had to set these variables to make netbeans ant work from command line: set ANT_HOME=C: PROGRA~1 netbeans-5.0 ide6 ant set
messageBody:
Pat,

On Windows, I had to set these variables to make
netbeans ant work from
command line:

set ANT_HOME=C:\PROGRA~1\netbeans-5.0\ide6\ant
set
classpath=%classpath%;c:\progra~1\netbeans-5.0\ide6\modules\ext\junit-3.8.1.jar
set path=C:\PROGRA~1\netbeans-5.0\ide6\ant\bin;%path%

Regards, Jan

----- Original Message -----
From: Pat Farrell
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, March 23, 2006 4:07 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit works great in IDE, how do
I run it from a shell?


Daryl Richter wrote:
> Make sure that you have junit.jar in your
$ANT_HOME/lib directory.

I created a $ANT_HOME environment variable, pointed it
to
ANT_HOME=/opt/netbeans-5.0/ide6/ant

and did a softlink for junit.jar pointing to the
ant-junit.jar in the $ANT_HOME/lib

So far, no change, still complains

Thanks

--
Pat Farrell
http://www.pfarrell.com/
